docs.snippet: Former vice president Al Gore joins Richard Branson in the hunt for technological solutions to global warming......
docs.lead_paragraph: In " An Inconvenient Truth," the Oscar-nominated documentary on Al Gore's drive to limit global warming, the former vice president stressed that personal and political will were the only missing factors in limiting smokestack and tailpipe emissions linked to rising temperatures.
docs.abstract: Former vice president Al Gore joins Richard Branson in the hunt for technological solutions to global warming...

headline.main: Gore Seeks Technological Solutions for a Few Inconvenient Truths

docs.snippet: Swedes are cool, ergo the Bagger is cool. And that's that....
docs.lead_paragraph: Being an Oscar blogger during the first few weeks of February is, ah, I think the technical term is "a long, frickin haul," but it does have some upsides. A while back, the Bagger took time out to do a podcast for Voccine, a Swedish pop culture site run by Christina Jeurling and Tomas Seo. They were smart and funny, and the Bagger didn't think much about it until he recently received a gorgeous, hand-built invitation to their annual Oscar party.
docs.abstract: Swedes are cool, ergo the Bagger is cool. And that's that.

headline.main: How Do You Say 'I'd Like to Thank My Agent' in Swedish?

docs.snippet: Charlize, what were you thinking? We'll never know....
docs.lead_paragraph: Charlize Theron, insert obligatory Oscar hook here winner of the best actress Oscar in 2003 for "Monster," was being interviewed by Rich Sanchez on CNN about "East of Havana," a documentary she produced on rappers in Cuba. After Ms. Theron compared the lack of artistic freedom in the United States to those in Cuba, Mr. Sanchez, who is of Cuban heritage, incidentally, got a little puffed up and did that TV thing they do when they know they have a whiff of controversy before them. Ms. Theron pushed back gamely for a while until she, well, sort of flipped out. Here's a transcription of the last part of the interview.
docs.abstract: Charlize, what were you thinking? We'll never know.

docs.snippet: Does Dame Helen Mirren have sand in her clothes? -- a Bagger investigative report....
docs.lead_paragraph: Back in the day -- well, the Bagger is one of the whitest people alive, so what he actually means to say is: A couple of years ago, the Bagger was covering publishing and lad magazines. Photo spreads of models tugging and twisting their garments were all the rage back then. The Bagger asked Bob Guccione Jr. who published Gear magazine, an American version of the British lad mag, what was the deal with all of the clothing being pulled about, and he said, "We , we've got a problem with sand on our shoots."
docs.abstract: Does Dame Helen Mirren have sand in her clothes? -- a Bagger investigative report.

headline.print_headline: A Fugue for Good German Men

docs.snippet: Poor Ennio Morricone, the object of a Celine Dion serenade at the Oscars....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Bagger's house, when we want to signal that someone or something has jumped the shark, we clench our right fist and bounce it off our chest before finishing with hand upraised and fingers splayed, which is otherwise known as getting in touch with our inner Celine Dion. Now as sure as we are that composer Ennio Morricone deserves his tribute, we're also pretty sure no good can come of the decision to unleash Dion again (it's her fifth appearance) at the Oscars. We're still trying to recover from the trauma of those Chrysler commercials.
docs.abstract: Poor Ennio Morricone, the object of a Celine Dion serenade at the Oscars.

docs.snippet: A fantasy Oscar league open to all....
docs.lead_paragraph: Have you always felt that you were just a little smarter than the rest? You know, there's the keepers of the conventional wisdom, and then there is little old idiosyncratic you?
docs.abstract: A fantasy Oscar league open to all.
